intro: Stachys cymosa, commonly known as woolly betony, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its hairy, gray-green foliage and spikes of purple or pink flowers. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or meadow habitats. Stachys cymosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
